intro: Bonamia brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bonamia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bonamia brevifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
